page.title: 01WHITFIELD MOOR
page.content: Whitfield moor slopes gently from the twin peaks of Pike Rigg and Whitfield Law (525m) part of the lower range of hills directly to the east of the highest part of the North Pennines - towards West Allendale to the East. Carr's Burn curs across the east of the block , draining the upland area of marshy wetland, peat and heather. The northwest area is inaccessible in wet weather, drainage internally to Whitfield Lough. there are no inhabited buildings and no shelter apart from two ruined shepherd huts near Pike Rigg. The main, unfenced, Hexham - Alston Road passes through the extreme southeast corner of the block, as does an old drovers road from Alston to Whitfield. The area is unenclosed except for the extreme west, which has some stone dykes and fences, many is disrepair. It is rough
